world. Since February 12, the Russian capital Masca
has deployed 10 cleaning robots in
parks in the city. This is an
important step forward for  Russia in
applying modern technology to improve
the living environment and creating a
smart robot city called Pixel participates in
regular cleaning of walkways in
kusmi sokoni parks and October 55 parks.
Testing of
this first unmanned autonomous cleaning robot began
last month. The Pixel robot
is equipped with
various replaceable accessories so that it can operate
year-round and in almost any situation.
weather conditions Snow removal in winter sweeping and
washing roads in summer electric battery is
designed for up to 16 hours of robot usage
maximum speed during
robot operation is 5 km/h Pixel works very
quietly  and can clean the streets at
night. This device is equipped with a
multi-sensor system including radar lida,
sound-receiving sensor and surveillance camera
when encountering obstacles. The robot quickly
recognizes and acts according to the algorithm.  It is
certain that the company that developed this robot
plans to put it into mass production
in the second half of this year.
Heart-shaped chocolate candies have become a
traditional gift
given to each other by couples on Valentine's Day.
Valentine's Day February 14 in Italy,
one of the new choices for
couples this year is
tosta barossi cake, a delicate and sophisticated traditional cake that fully expresses the
sweet and loving feelings of
totta barui cake.  Made from
chocolate peanuts and almonds mixed
with beaten egg whites, the cake is
rich in nutrients but still
soft and fluffy to highlight the flavor.
Baking experts add
cocoa powder and chocolate.  Bitter with a little wine,
one of the secrets to keeping the cake from
drying out is to set the baking time
just enough and not leave it too long. In Italy,
Tota cake is often used as a
traditional mouth-watering dish, born in
1886.  This type of cake is always
preserved and many people have tried
combining the ingredients in
their own way. The current flavor of totta barui
was born in
1897 and is the work of Italian pastry chef
Urino Golini and is named after the cake.
